page.title: 06BUILDINGS OLD AND NEW
page.content: There is a scatter of{medieval buildings, mostly farm buildings. In addition some smaller old houses are basically{timber framed Weald type houses with red brick walls and lattice casement windows. Some{large stately houses}were built in late Victorian or early Edwardian times.After World War One a number of bungalows were erected. After the Second War{a large central housing {estate was developed in Nicholsfield. Lately a number of new houses and luxury bungalows have been built. Recently the old{Combination Stores, once owned by the Cokelers,{have been {demolished,}and{a new complex}is being developed, consisting of 4 shops and 5 houses. {Lindon House ,}once housing antiques, {is being converted}into 4 luxury flats, with 2 chalet bungalows.
